recoveryObjectivesChecks.name: RTO/RPO Documentation and Tracking
recoveryObjectivesChecks.description: Recovery Time Objectives and Recovery Point Objectives should be formally documented and systematically tracked

testResults.details: 82.4% documentation coverage with systematic tracking and version control
Clear criticality classification with appropriate RTO/RPO targets for each tier
Board approval, executive oversight, and regular review processes in place

recoveryObjectivesChecks.remediation: RTO/RPO documentation comprehensively implemented with strong governance and tracking

recoveryObjectivesChecks.name: Infrastructure Capability Assessment
recoveryObjectivesChecks.description: Infrastructure capabilities should be assessed and validated against defined recovery objectives

testResults.details: 84.4% VM replication coverage with 78.3% geo-redundant storage implementation
35-80 minute recovery times align with defined 1-4 hour RTO targets
15-minute maximum data loss exposure meets defined RPO requirements

recoveryObjectivesChecks.remediation: Infrastructure capabilities adequately support defined recovery objectives with strong automation

recoveryObjectivesChecks.name: Inadequate Business Impact Analysis
recoveryObjectivesChecks.description: Business impact analysis lacks comprehensive assessment and stakeholder validation for recovery objectives

testResults.test: Business impact analysis currency and completeness
testResults.details: BIA last updated 17 months ago with limited stakeholder participation

testResults.test: Financial impact calculation accuracy and validation
testResults.details: High-level revenue estimates without granular analysis or independent verification
No cost-benefit analysis or risk tolerance alignment for recovery objectives

recoveryObjectivesChecks.remediation: HIGH PRIORITY: 1) Conduct comprehensive business impact analysis with full stakeholder participation within 90 days, 2) Develop detailed financial impact calculations including operational costs, regulatory fines, and contractual penalties, 3) Perform cost-benefit analysis for different RTO/RPO scenarios with sensitivity analysis, 4) Establish regular BIA update cycle with semi-annual reviews and continuous stakeholder engagement, 5) Implement business impact quantification tools with automated data collection and analysis, 6) Validate RTO/RPO objectives through comprehensive risk tolerance assessment and alternative scenario modeling

recoveryObjectivesChecks.name: Missing Service Dependency Mapping
recoveryObjectivesChecks.description: Service dependency mapping lacks comprehensive analysis for recovery objective determination

testResults.details: 52.9% service mapping coverage with 35.3% external dependency coverage

testResults.test: Dependency impact analysis on recovery objectives
testResults.details: No quantified analysis of dependency impact on RTO/RPO objectives

testResults.test: Recovery sequencing and critical path analysis
testResults.details: High-level recovery order without dependency-based sequencing or bottleneck identification

recoveryObjectivesChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Complete comprehensive service dependency mapping for all 34 services with automated discovery tools, 2) Implement critical path analysis to identify recovery bottlenecks and sequence dependencies, 3) Perform cascading failure analysis to understand dependency impact on RTO/RPO objectives, 4) Develop dependency-based recovery sequencing with parallel recovery optimization, 5) Establish automated dependency monitoring with real-time mapping updates, 6) Create dependency resilience scoring to prioritize strengthening critical service relationships

recoveryObjectivesChecks.name: Insufficient Recovery Objective Validation
recoveryObjectivesChecks.description: Recovery objectives lack regular validation and real-world testing to ensure achievability

testResults.test: Recovery objective validation frequency and scope
testResults.details: Annual validation only with limited scope excluding business process validation

testResults.test: Actual vs target recovery time achievement analysis
testResults.details: 50-150% longer actual recovery times compared to defined RTO targets

testResults.test: Continuous improvement and objective adjustment process
testResults.details: No systematic validation analysis or objective adjustment process

recoveryObjectivesChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Implement quarterly recovery objective validation exercises with full business process testing, 2) Conduct comprehensive actual vs target RTO/RPO gap analysis with systematic improvement planning, 3) Establish regular cross-region failover testing with end-to-end user acceptance validation, 4) Develop automated recovery objective monitoring with real-time achievement tracking, 5) Create continuous improvement process with stakeholder feedback integration and industry benchmarking, 6) Implement recovery objective adjustment procedures based on validation results and changing business requirements
